result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyiontae A Evans

records.addlTxt: Order Granting Defense Motion to Withdraw, signed and filed.

Defendant Kyiontae A Evans appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Kyiontae A Evans.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference.
Defense's motion to withdraw heard. State takes no position. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Court ordered Attorney Flynn to submit a Motion to Withdraw & Order to the Court due to court reporter availability.
Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 29th, 2022.

Defendant Kyiontae A Evans appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Kyiontae A Evans.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case heard off the record. Defendant appears late. Court vacates stayed bench warrant and calendar call date. Case adjourned for status conference by Zoom, Branch15.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kyiontae A Evans not in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Kyiontae A Evans.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record due to no Court Reporter available. Case scheduled for status conference. Defendant failing to appear. Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.
Calendar call scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Kyiontae A Evans in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Kyiontae A Evans.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Kyiontae A Evans in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 13 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kyiontae A Evans not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 8/11/2022.  Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Kyiontae A Evans not in court.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/13/22 @ 2:30p
